info.name: Werewolf
info.description: A humanoid cursed with lycanthropy. Werewolves can transform into wolf or hybrid form, gaining enhanced strength, speed, and heightened senses at the cost of their humanity.
info.author: Fawkes

description.p: Cursed by the moon, werewolves exist in a constant struggle between humanity and beast.
Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Dexterity increases by 1.
Werewolves mature at the same rate as humans but live slightly longer due to their regenerative abilities.
Werewolves lean toward chaotic alignments, reflecting their untamed nature.
Your base walking speed is 35 feet. In wolf form, your speed is 40 feet.
You can transform into wolf or hybrid form as an action. Your equipment does not change form.
You regain 1 hit point at the start of your turn if you have at least 1 hit point.
You can make claw attacks (1d6 slashing) or bite attacks (1d8 piercing) in wolf or hybrid form.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell or hearing.
You can see in dim light within 60 feet as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light.
